citeinfo.title: NEAR-GOOS Regional Delayed Mode Data Base (RDMDB)

abstract.p: The oceanographic/marine meteorological data in the NEAR-GOOS region are maintained at the Regional Delayed Mode Data Base (RDMDB) operated by the Japan Oceanographic Data Center (JODC), which is responsible for the Regional Data Center for WESTPAC. The Regional Delayed Mode Data Base receives the data from the Regional Real Time Data Base (RRTDB) 30 days after they are collected. The Regional Delayed Mode Data Base also collects the data/products from the National Delayed Mode Data Bases (NDMDB) except those collected through Regional Real Time Data Base at http://goos.kishou.go.jp. First time users must register to gain database access.

descript.purpose: To offer basic data service to NEAR-GOOS and GOOS communities as part of the NEAR-GOOS project.

idinfo.accconst: First time users must register to gain database access.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: First time users must register to gain database access.
